job_title: Outpatient Coder in Crescent City, CA
pros: Good people to work with in the clinic but difficult to connect with all of the temporary physicians.  This team has seen a lot of personnel changes but still functions well together.
cons: Not enough permanent physicians-too many temporary physicians working two week shifts. Also too many specialties for one person to code without any help.

review_title:
One of the best places I've worked
Decades of nursing experience, sutter has a real heart and soul
pros: Staff and education friendly. Supervisors work to empower employees
cons: Can be difficult to advance, employees often stay for decades, don't expect to get seniority fast

review_title: SPS is a good and stable place to work. They breed great managers and honestly care about employees.
job_title: Reporting Analyst II in Sacramento, CA
pros: The benefits are amazing, time is flexible, and training is abundant.
cons: Non-industry standard job titles lead to issues if an employee wants to move on or make a case for a raise.

pros: Organization has Talented staff. Historically the company has been very employee oriented. My Division gies me a sense of pride in what we accomplish.
cons: Currently there is an unknown future with the parent company, Sutter Health. New leadership doesn’t have the history of our company to know how well we have done on our own.

pros:

review_title: Laid off after nearly 30 years due to our new National Healthcare Initiative.
pros: Salary, health insurance, paid time off, vision, dental, however they are cutting these.  Management used to be good before Sutter took over.
cons: Outsourcing every thing possible and consolidating hundreds of office support jobs to one center for all Sutter Health affiliated hospitals and medical groups, HIM, accounting, HR, EAP.  Hundreds have beeb laid off.

review_title: Great Company, Great Benefits - Hard to move up
job_title: Deposit Services Representative/Payment Posting Representative/Eligibility Representative in Sacramento, CA
pros:
1. Benefits package and employer contribution to employee and dependent cost of insurance is amazing

2. Expectations are clear

3. Communication with management constant and clear

4. Ease to move laterally through the company and explore different departments
cons:
1. Hard to move up into leadership roles 

2. Some managers practice favoritism

review_title: I had the best experience as a new nurse!
job_title: LVN Charge Nurse in Sacramento, CA
pros: Great benefits. A good working environment. Lots of room for growth
cons: At times, events are not all inclusive. Not all employees are publicly recognized for their hard work.

job_title: Database Administrator III in Sacramento, CA
pros: Multiple skills are encouraged.  Very challenging environment.  Knowledgable peers.
cons: Compensation and advancement opportunities are lacking

job_title: Team Leader in West Valley City, UT
pros: Great benefits (insurance, PTO, some OT, paid holidays, etc). Friendly and approachable employees/management. Great advancement opportunities.
cons: It depends on what department/team you're on. I love the team I work with (some of upper management and I have personality clashes - not too big of a deal though.)

pros: Mission values employees are well taken care of great pay and benefits able to grow and build a career flexible schedule
cons: Complex large organization can be confusing to navigate and find tools and experts within too many competing priorities work can be frustrating if not recognized

pros: Top healthcare provider in Northern California. Proud to be associated with the organization
cons: IT remains out of touch with healthcare business. Constant re-organizations made no improvement. Lack direction and vision in recent years.

pros: Great training and clinical competencies. CMAs are held accountable and responsible of their work and performance. It is easy to move around to other departments for further opportunities to gain more knowledge and experience. Building is beautiful and zen with state of the art equipment.
cons: Clinics are very busy. MD’s workload  can be demanding.

review_title: Worst and low paying garbage non profit
job_title: Outcomes Analyst III in Burlingame, CA
pros:
Work life balance.  
Nothing else.
cons:
Lowest paying non profit in Bay Area. 
Everything that you can think of.
Old school.
Head quarters of PAMF especially where the orientation happens will look like a mechanic shop or go down.
Sutter Health policy does not offer reference or recommendation if you leave Sutter Health.So, your chance of landing a better job may be in trouble.
No bonus.
No relocation expense.
No upward mobility.
Revolving door.
Toxic culture with politics.

pros: Great colleagues to work with.
cons: C-Suite with heads in the clouds and no idea about the front line. Changes made without respect for long time employees. Little regard for employee input. And all without a moment’s notice. I have hope that this will be a nice place to work one day again. For now, look elsewhere

job_title: Operations Manager in West Valley City, UT
pros: Truly cares about people.  Allows you to grow and develop at your pace but supports you along the way.
cons: Always changing and can be stressful.

review_title: I have been pleased with my experience at Sutter Health
pros: The benefits are good - health, dental, vision.  I've worked with some really great people and there is room for advancement.
cons: With any large matrixed organization, it is sometimes difficult to get past the bureaucracy, processes; sometimes too much structure is cumbersome.

pros: Opportunities to work in the clinical setting, great friendly employees in several departments I have worked with, flexible, collaboration
cons: Parking, slight room for growth and on toes of unofficial timelines

pros: Good hours. Nothing else comes to mind.
cons: Clicks at work, lazy co-workers, HORRIBLE communication, short staffed, unorganized, disrespectful/unappreciative providers, benefits are not worth it they don't give you what they promise.

pros: Co-workers, decent benefits, free parking
cons: Not a good place to work if you're in IT or infirmation Security. Constant reorganizations and clueless leadership.

review_title: Upper management asks the world and makes everything impossible
job_title: Lead Network Engineer in Rancho Cordova, CA
pros: I loved working with the team of engineers and architects
cons: Upper management asks the impossible. Middle management refuses to stand up for themselves and explain why things can't be done.

job_title: Staff Nurse Operating Room in Roseville, CA
pros: great physician staff to work with,
cons: managers play favorites, organization owes back wages to employees for lunch and overtime.  policies seem to change with the circumstances, nothing is consistent

review_title: Love my job, co-workers, and pay
pros: Great pay and opportunities for advancement! My boss always seems to have my best interest in mind and never expects me to work after I'm off the clock,,,that's family time.
cons: I don't really have any complaints, like with all jobs sometimes the co-workers can be difficult.

review_title: Great learning opportunity for entry level and managers
pros: Ability to move up and "career search" throughout company.  There are more opportunities with this company to move around and get a feel for what you want to do long term.
cons: This company is lacking in technological advancement, and workplace diversity.

pros: flexible work from home days
cons: no training; poorly/untrained supervisory staff; no lateral movement

pros: Great benefits. Bonus capabilities. Friendly employed and good support from upper management. Salaries are comparable to other facilities in the region
cons:
Front line staffing could use some additional bedside nurses.. 
Financially focused, but reasonable for a health care company. Not enough front line staff

job_title: Front Desk Volunteer in Berkeley, CA
pros: Great people come in everyday and you get to help  them in some way
cons: It is volunteer work so you don't have enough responsibilities.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Rancho Cordova, CA
pros: Great leadership, caring company, great co-workers.  I have been here 7 years and wouldn't dream of leaving.  In my division the majority are all long term employees.
cons: I personally don't have any "cons".

pros: Great benefits, great work life balance, a LOT of opportunity. Within the last 7 years here I went from making under 20k to 88k. Lots of growth.
cons: Depends who you work for...to be quite honest.

review_title: get stepped on as lower management climbs the ladder
pros: benefits/pay, business acumen that has acquired talent
cons: Corporate work culture that lacks empathy.  Leadership is very politically motivated and have lost their humanity. No vehicle or venue for bottom-up innovation.

pros: Great Pay, Great Health Care Benefits, Great People, United mission centered around patient care in my community.
cons: Long bureaucratic process delay good strong performers from working well.  As with some other jobs who you know really makes a big difference.  Difficult to advance internally

pros: Great benefits.  Nice people to work with.  Good team environment.
cons: When looking for other positions internally (promotions, position change), existing employees are not given preferential treatment.  Must compete with everyone that applies externally.

review_title: Sutter health is a great place to work!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: Friendly and employees, great benefits, great treatment of employees, and an all around great place to work.  Great learning environment.
cons: There are really no cons to working here, it really is a great place to work.  I would recommend the company.

pros: Great Company to work for. Up to date on the newest Equipment. Education is very important here. Great work flow and team efforts.
cons: Busy Trauma center in the heart of the Central Valley. Sutter is a large corporation, I do miss the small town hospital feeling.

review_title: Not all Sutters are created equal
pros: Some facilities open to accepting candidates with less experience
cons: Unhappy staff, bad call schedule/call pay; no backup childcare benefit; schedule posting very late; no nursing union

pros: I wish I would have worked for Sutter my whole Nursing career
cons: Sometimes Micro-managed by non medical supervisors.

job_title: PSR SEBMF in West Valley City, UT
pros: Friendly envirorment, Management always looking for feed back. Work is fun
cons: Yearly raise is very small comparied to other compaines. The starting pay could also be higher There is alot of favoritism as far as opportunities go in SEBMF and HR and hiring team is extremley rude

review_title: Getting too big for their britches
pros: Work with great team members
cons: Sutter is starting to look more at the $ than patient care by increasing demands and duties of staff without looking at patient safety

job_title: Patient Service Representative in West Valley City, UT
pros: Training staff are extremely positive and sincerely enjoy their job. They do a great job of preparing you for the position you are hired for.
cons: Computers can often slow down and programs can shut down making day to day work difficult.

job_title: Clinical Supervisor in Palo Alto, CA
pros: Patient and their care is a first priority. People are welcoming and focused on the healthcare improvements. The pay is fair for the position.
cons: No different that any other company that is experiencing growing pains. Centralized control can be cumbersome.

review_title: Think twice about Memorial Medical Center, Modesto
pros: Great benefits for the entire family
cons: Managers are too focused  on the bottom line and not the patient's needs. Poor management has run many great workers out and to employers who value their employees.

job_title: Medical Social Worker in Emeryville, CA
pros: Flexibility with work schedule,  wonderful  co-workers, good benefits, and patients are wonderful to work with.
cons:
Goals are always changing. 
Managements are not experience and overwhelmed.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in West Valley City, UT
pros: This is a fast growing company with an excellent culture. There are lots of opportunities for growth, and the ability to move up in the company.
cons: This is call center work. Working on the phones for 8 hours a day can by trying at times.

pros: Good benefits, nice location. Patients are the best part of the job.
cons: Poor management, no advancement. If you dont have a college degree, your stuck in entry level positions.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: I really enjoyed my time with Sutter Health.  Everyone was professional, friendly and helpful with anything that I needed.
cons: It was hard to check in the patient in such a short amount of time, but I understand why it was necessary.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Sacramento, CA
pros: The longer you work for Sutter the better the benefits
cons: Very hard to work your way up the management chain.  It not what you know it is who you know.

pros: Great Health Benefits, 403K, Pension, FSA, PTO
cons: Company needs to learn that longevity means something and they should help promote their staff from within. No succession planning for non-exempt employees.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Santa Clara, CA
pros: Free health care for staff and family members of staff member. I think it's a great company to work for, Competative pay and the orginazation helps the community a lot!
cons: Haven't found a thing to complain about in the 3 years I've worked here

review_title: Sutter is a great Health Care System  to work for
pros: Great clinical work, large employer, many locations
cons: Large employer, centralized operations out of Roseville, CA.  Company is bracing itself for health care reform with sweeping changes and centralization  of business operations.

review_title: Difficult to get through the employment process

pros: Great benefits, caring and compassionate culture, and driven for a purpose... it’s All about the patient and the families we serve.
